intro: Orellana americana var. leiocarpa, commonly known as the white-flowered orellana, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its showy, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. Its leaves are ovate to elliptic, with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. The fruit is a capsule that contains numerous small, dry seeds.
